page.title: 10CONSTANTINE FARMING 2
page.content: FARMING AT SEA ;An industry which has existed for many years is the growing of oysters in the Helford River for distribution to local hotels and to be sent to London for sale at Billingsgate fish market.The oyster farm is situated on the river at Port Navas and is owned by Mac Fisheries LTD.It is managed by MR.Len.Hodges who has part time workers to assist him.The small oysters are called "spats",and are sent down to the Helford River from farms in Scotland.They are then planted in beds in the river and carefully marked.Constant inspection is required over the growing time because all sorts of disease can attack the young oyster.When fully grown the oysters are dredged up and placed in cleaning tanks of fresh water for a week before being packed fresh for marketing.
